trans-unit.source: Analyze Twitter data with Hadoop in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Analyze Twitter data with Hadoop in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Hive to analyze Twitter data on Hadoop in HDInsight to find the usage frequency of a particular word.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Hive to analyze Twitter data on Hadoop in HDInsight to find the usage frequency of a particular word.

trans-unit.source: In this document, you will get tweets by using a Twitter streaming API and then use Apache Hive on a Linux-based HDInsight (preview) cluster to process the JSON formatted data.
trans-unit.target: In this document, you will get tweets by using a Twitter streaming API and then use Apache Hive on a Linux-based HDInsight (preview) cluster to process the JSON formatted data.

trans-unit.source: The result will be a list of Twitter users who sent the most tweets that contained a certain word.
trans-unit.target: The result will be a list of Twitter users who sent the most tweets that contained a certain word.

trans-unit.source: While individual pieces of this document can be used with Windows-based HDInsight clusters (Python and Hive for example,) many steps are based on using a Linux-based HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: While individual pieces of this document can be used with Windows-based HDInsight clusters (Python and Hive for example,) many steps are based on using a Linux-based HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: For steps specific to a Windows-based cluster, see <linkText>Analyze Twitter data using Hive in HDInsight</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For steps specific to a Windows-based cluster, see <linkText>Analyze Twitter data using Hive in HDInsight</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Before you begin this tutorial, you must have the following:
trans-unit.target: Before you begin this tutorial, you must have the following:

trans-unit.source: A Linux-based Azure HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: A Linux-based Azure HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: For information on creating a cluster, see <linkText>Get Started with Linux-based HDInsight</linkText><title></title> for steps on creating a cluster.
trans-unit.target: For information on creating a cluster, see <linkText>Get Started with Linux-based HDInsight</linkText><title></title> for steps on creating a cluster.

trans-unit.source: An SSH client.
trans-unit.target: An SSH client.

trans-unit.source: For more information on using SSH with Linux-based HDInsight, see the following articles:
trans-unit.target: For more information on using SSH with Linux-based HDInsight, see the following articles:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Linux, Unix, or OS X</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Linux, Unix, or OS X</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Windows</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Windows</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Python and pip
trans-unit.target: Python and pip

trans-unit.source: The Azure CLI.
trans-unit.target: The Azure CLI.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Install and configure the Azure CLI</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Install and configure the Azure CLI</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Twitter allows you to retrieve the <linkText>data for each tweet</linkText><title></title> as a JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) document through a REST API.
trans-unit.target: Twitter allows you to retrieve the <linkText>data for each tweet</linkText><title></title> as a JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) document through a REST API.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>OAuth</linkText><title></title> is required for authentication to the API.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>OAuth</linkText><title></title> is required for authentication to the API.

trans-unit.source: You must also create a Twitter Application that contains the settings used to access the API.
trans-unit.target: You must also create a Twitter Application that contains the settings used to access the API.

trans-unit.source: From a web browser, sign in to <linkText>https://apps.twitter.com/</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: From a web browser, sign in to <linkText>https://apps.twitter.com/</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Click the Sign up now link if you don't have a Twitter account.
trans-unit.target: Click the Sign up now link if you don't have a Twitter account.

trans-unit.source: Click Create New App.
trans-unit.target: Click Create New App.

trans-unit.source: Enter Name, Description, Website.
trans-unit.target: Enter Name, Description, Website.

trans-unit.source: You can make up a URL for the Website field.
trans-unit.target: You can make up a URL for the Website field.

trans-unit.source: The following table shows some sample values to use:
trans-unit.target: The following table shows some sample values to use:

trans-unit.source: | Field | Value | |:----- |:----- | | Name | MyHDInsightApp | | Description | MyHDInsightApp | | Website | http://www.myhdinsightapp.com |
trans-unit.target: | Field | Value | |:----- |:----- | | Name | MyHDInsightApp | | Description | MyHDInsightApp | | Website | http://www.myhdinsightapp.com |

trans-unit.source: Check Yes, I agree, and then click Create your Twitter application.
trans-unit.target: Check Yes, I agree, and then click Create your Twitter application.

trans-unit.source: Click the Permissions tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the Permissions tab.

trans-unit.source: The default permission is Read only.
trans-unit.target: The default permission is Read only.

trans-unit.source: This is sufficient for this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: This is sufficient for this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Click the Keys and Access Tokens tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the Keys and Access Tokens tab.

trans-unit.source: Click Create my access token.
trans-unit.target: Click Create my access token.

trans-unit.source: Click Test OAuth in the upper-right corner of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Test OAuth in the upper-right corner of the page.

trans-unit.source: Write down consumer key, Consumer secret, Access token, and Access token secret.
trans-unit.target: Write down consumer key, Consumer secret, Access token, and Access token secret.

trans-unit.source: You will need the values later.
trans-unit.target: You will need the values later.

trans-unit.source: When you use the curl command in Windows, use double quotes instead of single quotes for the option values.
trans-unit.target: When you use the curl command in Windows, use double quotes instead of single quotes for the option values.

trans-unit.source: The following Python code will download 10,000 tweets from Twitter and save them to a file named tweets.txt.
trans-unit.target: The following Python code will download 10,000 tweets from Twitter and save them to a file named tweets.txt.

trans-unit.source: The following steps are performed on the HDInsight cluster, since Python is already installed.
trans-unit.target: The following steps are performed on the HDInsight cluster, since Python is already installed.

trans-unit.source: Connect to the HDInsight cluster using SSH:
trans-unit.target: Connect to the HDInsight cluster using SSH:

trans-unit.source: If you used a password to secure your SSH user account, you will be prompted to enter it.
trans-unit.target: If you used a password to secure your SSH user account, you will be prompted to enter it.

trans-unit.source: If you used a public key, you may have to use the -i parameter to specify the matching private key.
trans-unit.target: If you used a public key, you may have to use the -i parameter to specify the matching private key.

trans-unit.source: For example, ssh -i ~/.ssh/id_rsa USERNAME@CLUSTERNAME-ssh.azurehdinsight.net.
trans-unit.target: For example, ssh -i ~/.ssh/id_rsa USERNAME@CLUSTERNAME-ssh.azurehdinsight.net.

trans-unit.source: For more information on using SSH with Linux-based HDInsight, see the following articles:
trans-unit.target: For more information on using SSH with Linux-based HDInsight, see the following articles:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Linux, Unix, or OS X</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Linux, Unix, or OS X</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Windows</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Windows</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: By default, the pip utility is not installed on the HDInsight head node.
trans-unit.target: By default, the pip utility is not installed on the HDInsight head node.

trans-unit.source: Use the following to install, and then update this utility:
trans-unit.target: Use the following to install, and then update this utility:

trans-unit.source: The code to download tweets relies on <linkText>Tweepy</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>Progressbar</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: The code to download tweets relies on <linkText>Tweepy</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>Progressbar</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: To install these, use the following command:
trans-unit.target: To install these, use the following command:

trans-unit.source: The bits about removing python-openssl, installing python-dev, libffi-dev, libssl-dev, pyOpenSSL and requests[security] is to avoid an InsecurePlatform warning when connecting to Twitter via SSL from Python.
trans-unit.target: The bits about removing python-openssl, installing python-dev, libffi-dev, libssl-dev, pyOpenSSL and requests[security] is to avoid an InsecurePlatform warning when connecting to Twitter via SSL from Python.

trans-unit.source: Tweepy v3.2.0 is used to avoid <linkText>an error</linkText><title></title> that can occur when processing tweets.
trans-unit.target: Tweepy v3.2.0 is used to avoid <linkText>an error</linkText><title></title> that can occur when processing tweets.

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to create a new file named gettweets.py:
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to create a new file named gettweets.py:

trans-unit.source: Use the following as the contents of the gettweets.py file.
trans-unit.target: Use the following as the contents of the gettweets.py file.

trans-unit.source: Replace the placeholder information for consumer/_secret, consumer/_key, access/_token, and access/_token/_secret with the information from your Twitter application.
trans-unit.target: Replace the placeholder information for consumer/_secret, consumer/_key, access/_token, and access/_token/_secret with the information from your Twitter application.

trans-unit.source: Use Ctrl + X, then Y to save the file.
trans-unit.target: Use Ctrl + X, then Y to save the file.

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to run the file and download tweets:
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to run the file and download tweets:

trans-unit.source: A progress indicator should appear, and count up to 100% as the tweets are downloaded and saved to file.
trans-unit.target: A progress indicator should appear, and count up to 100% as the tweets are downloaded and saved to file.

trans-unit.target: Use the following command to run the HiveQL contained in the file:

trans-unit.source: This will load the Hive shell, run the HiveQL in the twitter.hql file, and finally return a hive > prompt.
trans-unit.target: This will load the Hive shell, run the HiveQL in the twitter.hql file, and finally return a hive > prompt.

trans-unit.source: From the hive > prompt, use the following to verify that you can select data from the tweets table created by the HiveQL in the twitter.hql file:
trans-unit.target: From the hive > prompt, use the following to verify that you can select data from the tweets table created by the HiveQL in the twitter.hql file:

trans-unit.source: This will return a maximum of 10 tweets that contain the word Azure in the message text.
trans-unit.target: This will return a maximum of 10 tweets that contain the word Azure in the message text.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial we have seen how to transform an unstructured JSON dataset into a structured Hive table to query, explore, and analyze data from Twitter by using HDInsight on Azure.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial we have seen how to transform an unstructured JSON dataset into a structured Hive table to query, explore, and analyze data from Twitter by using HDInsight on Azure.
